text: 330ml bottle. Muddy chocolate brown, medium beige head. Lots of malty, spice, raisin aromas. Flavors are stewed fruit, cinnamon, sweet malt, caramel. Evident alcohol, long finish starts dry finishes sweeter. Nice.
Bottle in Holy Craft, Dusseldorf. Dark brown with a big cream head. Toffee aroma. Very full flavoured with a lot of toffee and a little liquorice and spice. Creamy mmouthfeel. Extremely good.

bottle, dark cherry colour, off white/beige head.
odour: sweet, elderberry, honey, caramel
flavour: alcohol, malty, caramel.
medium bitterness (lasting), medium to heavy sweetness (lasting), warming effect of the alcohol.

330 ml bottle. Pours a clear dark copper with a quickly diminishing off-white head. The aroma is malty, caramel, honey, brown sugar and also some alcoholic note, slightly medicinal, glue. Full oily body with a low carbonation, a light sweetness and a medium bitterness. The flavor is very malty, honey, molasses, prunes, dates with a light alcoholic warming and a decent hoppy bitterness to balance the sweetish malt.

Pours a dark brown. No head. Looks like iced tea. Label has the date on it but I cant read it. Sweet, sugary molasses aroma. Intermingled with liquor soaked plums and figs. Flavor is sweet but not cloying. Plums, digs, dates, and brown sugar. Malt driven is an understatement. Theres a touch of soapiness to it as well. Not much, if any, hop character. Barley wine similarities. Its actually better than some barley wines Ive had. Full mouth feel. Its lush. More winter warmer or fireside brew than anything. Nicely done.
Flavour-heavy with tastes of sweet molasses, yeast, and a touch of licorice. Essentially a german dubbel ale
Somewhere between liquid bread and a belgian ale. Good balance between sour (umami?) and understated sweetness. As far as alco, wouldnt even guess it contained any.

From Freistädter; dark brown to black, unclear, with small to medium off-white to brown head; aroma is very sweet malty, caramel, dark malts, plums; taste is very sweet malty, dark malts, yeasty spicy, perfume, alcohol, molasses, herbal hoppy bitter finish; texture is sticky with medium carbonation and thick body

Bottle from the Good Spirits Co Wine & Beer. Pours a slightly hazy dark brown witha short lived tan froth. Nose is intense malt loaf and fruit cake plus a touch of banana. Taste is treacle toffee, bittersweet. Palate is a little sticky. The alcohol is rather noticeable.

Dark ruby muddy brown. Yeasty aroma, cherry, brown sugar aroma. Similar to the sticke, but somewhere between a doppelbock and English barley wine. Raisins, cognac, cherry, nice really tasty brew. Best Uerige hands down.

0.33l bottle thanks to Cristobal37. Clear dark amber body with an off white head. Aroma of caramel, orange zest, raisins and cloves. Taste of toast, orange zest, caramel, raisins, roasted malts and floral hops. Great beer.
Bottle at Great Grog fair. Dark reddish brown. Nose is almost like malt extract. Tastes very malty, sweet caramel, some fruitiness, almost knocking on barley wines doors.

kindly given by Impuritylaw, thanks a lot! at a blind tasting, I would have guessed this was a British Ale, with its nose of dark caramel, dark fruits and herbal hops and its malty body with rum raisin hints and quite some residual sweetness. Unique in this scenario is the dry finish and the moderate bitterness that is building up towards the finish and in aftertaste. A great beer I would absolutely drink again.

Muddy chestnut brown. White head. Big caramel, bread, nuts, prunes, esters on nose. Medium to full body. Rich maltiness on taste. Big prune. Light bitterness. Delicious. Perfect-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Really good aroma and also a very distinct taste to it. Not my favorite style but well made.

Dunkelbraun mit starkem Schaum, extrem intensives Malzaroma, die starke Malznote wird durch reichlich Bitterhopfen austariert, unterstützt durch hohen Alkoholgehalt, schmeckt eher nach Porter oder bitteren Stouts, weniger nach Alt, Schokolade, lange anhaltender Abtrunk. Ein außergewöhnliches Bier.
Clear dark ruby, tanned lacing foam head. Strong malty aroma, great comples taste. An Alt with spunk, roast malt, nice bitter.

Bottle, 11.2 fl.oz. Christmas gift from SecretSanta 2016 ! Many thanks Zlotta ! A sparkling dark brown beer with a medium beige head ; short retention. Caramel, red berries, vinegar notes, roast, licorice. Medium round sweet, light warming baseline, light dry bitter, light acid. Good body, light to medium oily texture, soft carbonation, sweet fruity acid finish. Overall, great !

Floral earthy and grassy hop aroma, caramel, bread, a little toasty, a bit fruity, amber clean color with a medium foam, sweet and bitter at the same time with a peculiar slighly sour feel, medium/full bodied. One of the strangest beers Ive ever tasted: you expect something like a doppelbock because you know its german but you get surprised beacuse its heavily hopped and not as clean as the other because of the ale yeast esters. If I had to taste it as blind Id say its an english strong ale.

BOTTLE 33 CL. Clear really dark ruby, beige head. Rich caramel and dark fruit aroma. Similar sticky malty taste, old dried prunes and raisins and a lot of spicy peppery bitterness in the finish. Might not be too sophisticated, but surely tasty.

A dark brown color with a beige head. The aroma contains some milk chocolate, raisins, caramel, and vanilla. The flavor is not as sweet as I was expecting and maybe a little on the dry side. Chocolate, malted milk balls, and caramel.dominate. The alcohol lets its presence be felt however. This is a bit barleywine-ish. Maybe a mix between a dopplebock and a barleywine. Overall this is unique and tasty it deserves the high praise.

12-01-17 // bottle shared at home. Pours a brownish beer, almost no head. Heavy sweetness. The term german barleywine is quite interesting because you can definitely associate this. Its very sweet malty, sweet caramel, also alcoholic. Interesting but I dont like the heavy sweetness.
A sort of english barley wine with lots of caramel and a blast of herbal hops. Medicine

330ml bottle. I feel like I have to add a note about the bottle before anything else. For some reason the long necked swing top bottle gives me a very good feeling about this beer. The design just screams craft and quality to me, and here I was thinking I didnt really care much for the visual presentation. The beer itself pours shiny dark brown with a redish hue and moderately lively two finger lighter brown head which slowly sinks down to form a more solid one finger head leaving plenty of lazing behind. The aroma is dominated by caramel with some light roasted notes, brown sugar, sweet brown bread and a slight nuttiness as well as refreshing citrus hops with almost a hot and spicy touch and a light promise of warming alcohol in the background. The taste is malty and somewhat sweet with caramel and nuttiness up front, followed by dried fruits and light hops adding some orange flavours as well as a light bitterness and finally ending in a beautiful mixture of everything. Smooth yet filling mouthfeel, light carbonation and aftertaste combining caramel sweetness and hop freshness in a fantastic way. This might be one of the best beers Ive had to date. It is not at all the most bold or complex in aroma or taste, but it comes together in an absolutely fantastic way. This is pure quality.

Taste is sweet, medium bitter, raisins, chocolate, caramel, malt, grapes, raspberries, alcohol is present. GREAT ONE...

Made me immediately long for the next bottle, which has unfortunately not been within my reach.

330 mL swing top bottle shared by ebone1988. Sigh. The pour is a darker brown color with a few ruby shines coming through. There is a light tan colored bubbly head that falls down to a thick collar. The sweet is really what I like. Caramel and light syrup just carry on into a light bitterness. Im not a fan of that really. The bitterness ruins this one for me. 330 ml bottle into tulip glass, best before 4/2016. Pours murky deep reddish brown color with a 1-2 finger dense light khaki head with good retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Light spotty soapy lacing clings around the glass, with a light amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of big raisin, plum, fig, date, pepper, pine, caramel, brown sugar, molasses, dark bread, light chocolate, leather, tobacco, herbal, and yeast/toasted earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great complexity and balance of dark/bready malt, fruity yeast, and earthy hop notes; with great strength. Taste of big raisin, plum, fig, date, pepper, pine, caramel, brown sugar, molasses, dark bread, light chocolate, leather, tobacco, herbal, and yeast/toasted earthiness. Moderate amount of herbal/spicy bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of raisin, plum, fig, date, pepper, pine, caramel, brown sugar, molasses, dark bread, leather, tobacco, and herbal/toasted earthiness on the finish for a while. Incredible complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/bready malt, fruity yeast, and earthy/spicy hop flavors; with a great malt/bitterness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Light-medium carbonation and medium-full bodied; with a very smooth, moderately sticky, and fairly creamy/slick mouthfeel that is great. A fair amount of dryness from bitterness against the sweetness after the finish. Alcohol is very well hidden with only a small warmth lingering after the finish. Overall this is an incredible imperial altbier style. All around awesome complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/bready malt, fruity yeast, and earthy hop flavors; and very smooth to sip on for the ABV. The designation as Germanys Barleywine for this beer is really a spot on interpretation of how it tastes. Seems to be in between English and American versions of the style; as it has a pronounced amount of hoppiness/bitterness, but also a lot of fruity yeast and malt complexity. A highly enjoyable offering all around.
Bottle. Pours a cloudy brown color with a medium white head. A big malty sweet nose, loads of whiskey like notes. Big sweet sugary notes, oxidation, berries, leather. Soft yeast. Awesome.
Bottle from Willows Market in Menlo Park, CA. Big boozy nose with notes of sweet liqueurs, bourbon, malts, caramel, licorice. Taste is sweet with an awesome bitter finish. This is a thick mister.

Bottle at home from Biervana, Munich, 12th September 15. Pours almost black, deep brown. Aroma is complex, caramel, banana, spice, molasses. Taste is rich dark fruit, sweet at first, caramelised banana, spice, liquorice, but great bitter hop kick on the finish. Excellent

Boozy, nice aroma, hard to drink. Heavy beer, like bear. Hard alt. It is a german art, german interpretation of barley wine. Good for october fest and late autumn. Too rare. Hard to find. Its a little bit smoked, but has fruity, liquiory notes. Fantastic beer but not my style .
Tap at Gingerman. Ruby brown pour. Nose is molasses and wine. Tastes of molasses, caramel, vinous, berries, brown sugar, malt. Slight boozy warming. Lingering finish.

Aussehen: Dunkelbraun mit leichter Schaumbildung. 
Geruch: Sehr einladende malzige Aromen: Rosinen, Pflaumen, Karamell, Pumpernickel
Geschmack: Sehr schwerer öliger Malzkörper, süß und sehr aromatisch. Dann stark bitter mit langem wärmenden Abgang.
Zurecht ein sehr geschätztes Bier!
KRS 311214. Red amber colour with a small beige head. Aroma is malt, caramel, bread. Flavour is rye, malt, caramel, bread, alcohol, hop. Nice beer.

It pours murky mahogany with copper highlights; the head is bone coloured and mousse like. The aroma has notes of: dark rye bread, fruit cake, molasses, and raisins. The taste is medium sweet that finishes heavy bitter; there are notes of: raisins, dark rum, pumpernickel, grapefruit zest, and citrus pith. The palate is full bodied and has light carbonation; the mouth feel is sticky with a long bitter finish. Overall, a great interpretation of the barely wine style.

Bottle @ home. Pours a dark brown liquid with a beige small head. Sweet and lightly vinous aroma with loads of maltiness raisins, plums, caramel. Taste is full bodied and with a duration that resembles madness. Fantastic. Flavors of nuts,caramel, syrup, herbs, malt, and ...

From bottle, Brewed in 2008, bottled 10.08, tasted on 15.06

Aroma: big fruits, sweet, figs, caramel, figs, very nice

Appearance: dark amber, near brown, very small tan head

Taste: Very alcoholic and warming. Somewhat chewy like a dopplebock. Very heavy.
Palate: medium to fully, oily, soft carbonation, bitter finish

Overall: Very complex. I picked this bottle up as a Dussledorf Alt-bier for BJCP tasting from my local bevy and didnt notice it was a dopplesticke. It was incredibly complex and very warming/alcoholic, but not overly alcoholic. Everyone mentioned it was like a barelywine, but I enjoyed this much more than any American barelywine that Ive had. Im saving another bottle for winter - I expect this to taste great around the fireplace.

From the bottle, pours dark oily liquid with thick beige head. nose of dark fruit like raisin. Taste is rich and full an Explosion of tastes, some hops and much sweetness. Long lasting warm and astringent bitter hop aftertaste. Great...

0,33 l bottle from REWE Budnik & Homberg, bottled in 2014. Clear, dark red with a thin, frothy, almost stable, tan head. Pleasant aroma of redcurrant, raisins, cherries, red grapes and a bit of port. Heavy, sweetish-fruity taste of raisins, molasses, prunes, figs and caramel. Long, slightly bitter and rather alcoholic, warming finish. Full body, oily and chewy mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Very heavy, barleywine-like beer. Decent winter warmer but a bit too alcoholic to be honest.

Bottle. Murky dark brown. Some caramel, dried fruit and biscuit, and a little bit of alcohol in the nose. Tastes alcoholic, dark dried fruit and sweet. Full body, syrupy texture and a little nutty finish.

Bottle from Vinmonopolet Lambertseter enjoyed at home
Pours dark, almost black in glass, creamy light tanned head. Smell of dark fruity malts, toffee, dried fruits, quite straight but at the same time exquisite! Modereate to medium sweet, dark fruits, toffee, dried fruits, hints of toast, dark fruit bitterness, fruit peel, medium bitter.. This is quite far away from the typical alt. Amazingly complex and interesting.

Bottle 33 cl.
Clear amber, minimal head. Sweet aroma of malt and some alcohol. Sweet caramel flavour.

27/4 33 bottle @ home (6 months old). Dark brown color. Little beige head. Aromas: sweet, toffee, red fruit. Retronasal: more red fruit, sticky toffee, sweet. Flavor is moderate sweet, moderate to full bitter. Medium bodied. Finishes slightly dry, with a good bitterness. Nice, almost a (US) barley wine.
How : bottle Appearance : murky light brown color, almost no head. Aroma : prunes, caramel, toffee, grape, madeira. Palate : medium to full body, soft carbonation.
Bottle shared by Cliff. Pours a dark brown with tan head. Aroma and taste are dominated by malts, but theres a pleasant hoppiness and slight alcohol burn.

Hazy, almost opaque brown with a fairly small head. Aroma very sweet, raisins, dark fruit, caramel, bubblegum. Taste...well... burnt raisins come to mind. And bunt sugar. Very sweet, but with a burnt note that is neither roasty nor toasty. As a barley wine its not bad, I guess, but it is an example of why mid-range crystal malts should be used sparingly.

UPDATED: APR 27, 2015 Aroma has dark fruits, plums, spices and chocolate. Flavor has malted caramel, chocolate and complex dark sugars... Almost an umami-like flavor as well! Finish is nicely balanced. Delicious beer!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Flaske 330ml fra Vinmonopolet, Tromsdalen. Veldig mørk brun. Uklar. Middels høyt farget skum som daler sakte. Etterlater seg tett lacing. God søt maltaroma. Oljeaktig munnfølelse. Smaken litt karamell med antydning til lakris. Bra øl - men ikke min stil.
Draft. Dark brown with an off white head. Very earthy with some toffee and spices. Could maybe use a touch more sweetness to balance but solid.

On bottle from Vinnonopolet Norway, on order ( bu). Brown color , some sediments and light foam. Medium/ high aroma intensity; malt, hops, dried fruits, slightly roasted with caramel & Toffee in the finish. Medium/ full body & medium/ high complexity. Some sweetness, balances good. Very Enjoyable 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330ml swing-top bottle with a long neck from Vinmonopolet Langnes. Cloudy dark brown coloured body. Rocky fawn-coloured head reduced to a remaining filmy layer. Spotty lacing. Mid-sweet dark malty nose, hints of earth and bread. Roasted malty flavours joined by leaves, toffee, and dried fruits added by dark spices. Warming malt-fruity sweetness to the ending. Fine bodied. Nice. A little too sweet though (Friday eve at home in Tromsø, 27.03.2015).

UPDATED: JUL 17, 2015 Bottle. Pours deep brown with reddish hues and creamy beige head. Aroma of dried fruits, light roast, caramel and herbal hops. Sweet, with flavors of prunes, raisins, caramel, soy sauce, a bit salty, strong herbal bitterness, alcoholic warmth down the throat. Medium-bodied, sticky mouthfeel. To be drunk slowly.

Bottle 330ml. Clear deep amber with medium creamy beige head. Aroma of karambola with notes of raisin and caramel. Complex flavor of sweetish caramel and raisin with notes of karambola and herbs, followed by nice fruity sourness, long lasting sour-sweet sticky finish. Moderate carbonation, oily texture, full-bodied. Rich and pleasant.
Bottle 33cl. Small grey colored layer. Color is clear dark red brown. Aroma is licorice, berries, wood, wine. Taste is very sweet. Licorice, bark, nail polish remover.

Bottle, thank potjebier! Deep brown pour with bubbles slowly rising through the viscous liquid to form a thin very creamy off white head. Aroma is intensely matly, rich barley sugar notes, very malty, light toast, definitely some english barleywine notes in here, toffee, caramel. Taste is sweet, lightly boozy. Palate is med-heavy bodied, good carb. Nice.

The color is clear medium amber and there is virtually no head. The aroma is moderate to heavy malty, caramel, light alcoholic, dried dark fruits. The flavor is light heavy sweet with a long duration. The body is medium, texture is watery to oily, carbonation is flat. Ompher is a fag. Aftertaste of dried fig/fag
Darkbrown and unfitered, firm head. Smells malty, dried fig, black bread. On the palate liquorice, dark bread, sweet, mouthfilling. Very concentrated beer.

Bottle. Pours a deep brown, near-black murky body with a large creamy, long-lasting off-white head. Nose is mild raisins, caramel, bread dough, grains and hints of licorice and soft herbs. Taste is licorice, caramel, herbs, cough syrup, grains and hints of dark syrup, toffee and brown sugar. Full, creamy body, soft to medium carbonation. Lovely stuff; kind of like a crossover between an imperial stout and a barley wine with a strong herbal profile. Highly enjoyable sipper; weird that the German market has marginalized such a treat over the years. Glad to have it available in Norway.

Bottle from Vinmonopolets BU. Pours quite dark brown, with a dense, two centimeter thick, beige head. Prune, dried fruit and lots of alcohol nose. Sweet. Almost no aftertaste. Thick body, soft carbonation. Quite dry ending. Prune, caramel, dried fruit, fruitcake and some hints of herbs. Alcohol is not very well hidden. Closer to an Imperial Stout than an Albier in my opinion. Ending is a bit abrupt.
Dunkel mørk rødbrun farve med lys beige skum. Lukt av malt, karamell, bær, eple. Smak av malt, karamell, bær, eple. Lett karbonert med en bittersøt avslutning.

Lukt: Friske frukter, rosin og krydder.
Utseende: Grumset brun farge.
Skum/kullsyre: Tynn hinne skum, ring langs kant.
Smak: Friske frukter, noe krydder, fin sødme i avslutningen.

Kommentar: Nydelig øl som mer enn gjerne prøves igjen ved en senere anledning.

Hazy, very deep copper to brown body with a creamy, quite dense, beige head that doesnt leave much lacing. Sweet, malty and rather strong aroma of caramel, dark dried fruits and alcohol. Strong flavour of caramel, burnt sugar, pine, flowers and soy sauce. Red berries and herbs in the back. Moderate sweet taste and a long-lasting, biting, stinging, herbal, quite heavy bitter finish. Full-bodied, smooth and creamy texture, soft carbonation. A bit too demanding. If I want a hopped sweet beer I prefer a barley wine.
[33 cl bottle, from Vinmonopolet Online]
Bottle with big thanks to Sabine. Dark brown with tan head. AAroma of cake mix, tootsie roll, dried fruit. Taste of dried fruit, caramel, toffee, cake. Very sweet and bitter
bottle at home ...copper ...thin white lacing ... soft sweet woody malty .. soft sherry nose .. soft sweet sticky toffee fruit .. ligth bitter woods ... herbal malts .. soft malt.. not me
Bottle at Craigs. Pours hazy dark brown with a thin white head. Aromas of caramel, sugar, sweet. Taste is sweet. Gluey texture, light herbs. Very sweet.
Bottle at Craigs. Pours hazy deep brown, nose is malty toffee, light smoke, taste is sweet, caramel, dry, chewy.

My oh my. What a surprise. I was relaxing in the coach and felt for an Altbier. Yeah I have one left. Hah. Opens it and I start imediately to wonder. This do NOT look like an Altbier. Is something wrong? Does not smell like it either. Very unclear brownish color with a fine off white head. And what an aroma. Bready, fruitcake and some yest. Altbier..ehhh I had to check ratebeer. What is it with this one. Aha other fellow ratebberians says the same thing. This is more a altwine. Full body. Tad sweet and a moderate bitterness. Oily and a bit soft carbonation. Powerful flavor. Toffee, caramel, fruitcake, bready and it feels like there is some whiskey as well. Lovely evening sipper.[Christmas gift from McTapps]

Bottle. Pours in cloudy dark body with ruby hints againts the light, medium frosty stable head. Aroma has nice plum sweetness, caramely, nutty, toffee. Dark berries, alcohol well hidden. Taste has high spruce, pine, bitterness with yeasty sweetness. Alcohol is pretty noticable in the after taste. Body is pretty heavy, low to medium carbonation.
Clear caramel with white head. Aroma is caramel, spice, apples, red berries and some floral notes. Aftertaste is caramel, spice, noble hops, red berries, vanilla and sweets. Overall: very refined!

Yellow brown with a beige head that by time ends in a ring. Aroma a little sourish - wett socks and dry old books. The taste of bitter malt, dried red fruit, caramell, grapefruit. The mouthfeel is refreshing even though a low carbonatin level. Aftertaste of carmell and bitter hops.

Swing top bottle 11.2 fl.oz. Poured into a Kölsch glass. Nearly opaque dark brown with red copper hue, big and stable creamy beige head, recedes slowly to a thick layer that remains, good lacing; very complex aroma, strong roasted malts nose, caramel, brown sugar, portwine, dried dark fruits (raisins, dates, figs), cocoa, coffee, cinnamon, cloves; taste is heavy sweet and slightly bitter, roasted malts, dark chocolate, dark fruit syrup; full body, slick texture, soft carbonation, aftertaste malty sweetbitter, more earthy bitter and peppery notes in the finish, bit alcohol; overall a very rich beer, strong but well-balanced.

(Bottle) Dark brown colour with foamy, beige head. Malty, slightly vinous nose with dark bread, dried fruit, burnt rubber, sweet liquorice and a touch of tar. Malty, roasted taste with black rye bread, dried fruit, raisins, liquorice, caramel, some coffee, a hint of soy sauce and a balanced spicy bitterness. Almost full body, with a slightly oily mouthfeel. Fairly sweet. Tasty and quite powerful, still fairly well balanced. As close to a barley-wine style alt as you could get. Very nice.

Hazy, dark brown. Light brown, small head. Intense scent of raisins, dried fruit and bee wax. Smooth mouth feel, low carbonation. Starting with some dark malty sweetness, dried fruit, some ripe cheese, evolving to a mighty bitter finish with some sweet-sour notes. A really great beer, comparable to some great belgium brews.
Not bad, not familiar with the style in general. Very little malty sweetness and bitterness. In general, normal

The beer pours an opaque brown color with a small off-white head, and the aroma blends toasted malt, earthiness, basement aromas, and grains. The taste is mildly sour, slightly umami, and a touch bitter with an aftertaste that is somewhat grainy and toasty. The palate fuses a slick texture, medium body, and a soft carbonation.

Deep amber to brown colour. Cool special caramel aroma with light nuts notes maybe. Very reach malty taste with reisin, caramel, and nuts is balanced with noble european hop bitterness especially in aftertaste where you can feel grass and herbs. This beer is really great one! Close trappist quad or strong dubbel (like westmalle).
Malzig, Lakritz, Karamellig, angebrannter Zucker. Recht trocken im Abgang, ein interessantes Bier.

Cloudy brown color, minimal off-white head. Aroma of dark fruits, berries, malt and caramel. Very pleasant taste which is similar to aroma; dark fruits, some brown sugar, even oaky notes and some spices. A bit boozy. Medium to heavy sweetness. Full bodied with creamy texture and soft carbonation. Great. (0,33l bottle)

Bottle. Pours a dark auburn brown with a small, stylish, beige head. Aroma is very malty, quite a bit of rye, sweet malt syrup, dark fruit, some chocolate. Taste is very malty, dark malt bread, some rye, little syrup, small alcohol. Caramel, semi-dry, some roast, quite resinous finish. Some chocolate. Fairly low carbonation.

Bottle. An unclear, brown beer with a small, beige head that lasts. The aroma is biscuity, roasted and bready, with licorice and heavy caramel sauce. Some alcohol. Its full-bodied and warming, lightly sticky on the palate, with a good bitterness. Perhaps a bit heavy on the palate, but sure tasteful. Roasted malts, chocolate, caramel sauce, nuts, bread crust and quite a lot of hoppyness. Resiny, almost mint-like. Warming alcohol too. Lasting roasted finish with a good sweetness, but sure enough not bitterness and alcohol to deal with it. A flavorful, lovely beer that I would very much like to repeat. Unbalanced, in a balanced way. Lovely. 141231

Bottle. Pours deep amber with a small off-white head. Aroma of malt, caramel, biscuits, bread and chocolate. Flavor is sweet and malty with some caramel, mints, biscuits, bread crust and chocolate. Medium ro full body, soft carbonation.

Bottle 330ml @ Geokkjer
[From trade with McTapps] Pours dark reddish brown with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, chocolate, biscuit, dried fruits, alcohol and floral. Taste is medium to heavy sweet and medium bitter with a long caramel, chocolate, bitter, dried fruity and grassy finish. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Cloudy brown color, average sized off white head. Aroma of caramel, wood, roasted malt, dark fruits, honey. Taste of caramel, wood, chocolate, dark fruits, roasted malt. Medium to full body, soft carbonation. Sweet, with light bitter finish. Complex stuff, simply awesome.

Bottle (trade with McTapps - thank you, Sabine!); pours a cloudy caramel color with thin tan head; sweet aroma of caramel, vanilla, malt, and a hint of alcohol; sweet taste with caramel, vanilla, and dark fruits; finish is light bitter with a hint of alcohol; very nice

Thanks to Agate. Bottle from Munich. 
Pours hazy brown to amber with small, beige top, min lasing. Aroma- intense malty sweet, caramely, berries alike, a bit boozy at the beginning, but later it dissapears, pleasant aroma with good hops presence. Flavor quite the same except some dark, roasted malts notes. Sweet and hoppy, medium to heavy bitter. Medium+ body, light dry finish. Only small size of bottle makes a bit sad.

A pretty potent beer, especially for a German. I can see why it rates on top of the category. Pours dark murky brown like mud without much head or lacing. Huge malt aroma with caramel, booze and a hint of raisin aroma. Roast is pretty potent here as well. Light sweet and bitter finish. Bottle.

cloudy cola-brown, mustard yellow at edges, thin, very fine, tan head, fades quickly to dusty, thin film. Aroma is chewy caramel, toffee, grass, beech-wood forest in the cold of winter (that is, it has pleasant woody/nutty notes in there.) Hints of earthiness. Flavor is boom! very barley-wine-esque: sweet syrupy spicy bitterness, pine and earthy hops. A bit cloying, but the hops keep it in check. A slight bit hot on the exhale, but this is also kept in check. Bitterness only has a slight lingering sensation. Nuttiness comes out as it warms. Body is medium-heavy, syrupy, with light carbonation, no burn, very soft and fine. The nutty wood in the aroma and the bitter-yet-restrained-slightly-hot finish are highlights for me.  I am surprised this is German.  It does indeed taste like an east-coast barley wine.  Just a bit too sweet for me

UPDATED: SEP 30, 2016 Flasche (33 cl), Bottled on: 12.11, vom Biershop Braugasthöfe, knapp 2 Jahre im Keller gelagert. - Tiefes Kastanienrot, trüb mit dunklen Schwebteilchen; sehr kurzlebiger Schaum. - In der Nase schwere dunkle Frucht mit Zitrusspitzen, bitterer Kakao, getoastetes Malz und weinige Süße. - Im Antrunk üppiges dunkles Malz, ein Rest von konzentrierter Karamelsüße, wuchtige, herb-ledrige Hopfenbittere und ein wenig likörartige Fruchtigkeit (in Rum getränkte Rosinen). Anklänge von Sojasoße und Hustensaft. Mild rezent, dicht, fast sämig. Im Abgang beinahe schmerzhaft wuchtige, ledrig-harzige Bittere und wärmender Alkohol. Enorm bitterer, lang anhaltender Nachtrunk. - Dieser Altbier-Doppelbock schmeckt wie die Karikatur eines normalen Uerige Alt, verdickt und sirupartig. Ein Bier der Extreme; definitiv nicht mein Fall. 
Neuverkostung mit einer frischen Flasche von Hopfen & Malz, Berlin, 26.9.2016. - An manche harte Drogen gewöhnt man sich ja, aber an dieses Bier kann ich mich nicht gewöhnen. 
Alte Bewertung: 2,2.

Tall 0,33 l bottle. Hard to get here in Germany. Pours out nearly black in the glass. No real head. Choco, coffie, berriefruits and licorice on the nose. Starts strange to me. Oily, malt, coffie, berriefuits, dark wood, hopy, with an unknown heavy sweetness, alcoholic. Complex. Not an easy to drink beer.
Dare I say Im not particularly impressed. All the flavors are there. But this is syrupy, and way too boozy.
Bottle from Bier-Deluxe.de. Dark brown color with small white head. Dark malt, rum in aroma. Dark malt, rum, licorice, honey, dark chocolate, raisins, alcoholic bitterness. Tasty.

11.2 ounce swing top bottle.

It pours a very dark brown with reddish hues with a 1 finger head of tannish foam.

Big caramel malt in the nose, very sweet smelling, kind of a maple syrup sweetness.

Sweet, for sure in the taste, it also brings a close to bitter dark chocolate flavour thats very nice; cuts the sweetness. Im getting some raisin like flavour and hints of other dark fruits.

Id call this full bodied as its very thick and luxurious to my palate. Lightish carbonation.

Wow, this is a grand brew, very enjoyable and satisfying.

Bottle shared by Dan at BFD Friday
Dark rich light fruit and toffee, nice cap to a great evening.

Had a bottle in St. Louis. Dark brown cloudy lots of yeast. Aroma is malt, dark fruit, alcohol. Flavor is much more dark fruit, far less malt, more alcohol than the alt. Big mouthfeel. Big strong high alcohol beer.

"Almost get run soaked raisins in the aroma. So dense. Figgy molasses, bready brown sugar, full flavored and full bodied. The flavor shows a bit more alcohol than the sublime nose, but this is still likely the best and biggest alt Ive ever had."

Ueriges strongest Alt, the premium version of Uerige Sticke, so to speak. Seasonal beer made with Munich malts and a secret hop tea; very heavy for the style. Light beige, stable, dense, sticky head, colour a very dark brownish bronze, clear with subtle sparkling. Rich aroma of sweet fruits and bitter spices, very agreeable perfume, plums, chocolate, pear syrup, sage, old jenever, pine resin, whisky, walnuts, coffee beans, jute, bark. Taste is Altbier all around but in a reinforced kind of way, with red fruits, thick nutty and chocolatey malts, silky, slick mouthfeel, pure with medium carbo, very spicy and earthy hop bitterness in the finish reinforced, but nowhere hindered, by a warming bourbon-like alcohol effect. This was very memorable - one of the best German beers I had so far and certainly the best Alt.

0,33 l swing top bottle 
caramel, alcohol, dried fruits, resin, nuts, herbs, grass, red-brown, hazy, frothy, tan foam, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, full body, oily feel, creamy, average carbonation, long finish,

The beer comes in the fliptop bottle and I think the seal is broken as the beer is slightly flat. Still had a very rich fragrant malt yeast ride bread molasses aroma. Almost no head no lace, and a slightly cloudy brownish amber color. Flavor is like aRoma, carbonic tang is surprisingly strong considering how mild carbonation is; bitterness is quite strong against the rich maltiness. I'd like to try a fresher or a better sealed bottle. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Shared by KyotoLefty at the Hanshin Seed Event. An opaque almost muddy brown pour. Great nose of candied plum, port, sweet dark fruits. Medium to light bodied. The taste is malty, boozy, sweet caramel, dark pitted fruits. A bit of that tannic oaky quality to it. Very interesting.

Bottle from backlog notes 07. Pours a hazy brown color with a small off white head. The aroma and flavor have caramel, toffee, nuts, raisins, spicy notes, toasted malts, some more general bitterness to the finish. Good, not great.

11.2 oz bottle poured into straight stemmed glass. Pours a nice, dark, chestnut brown with no head at all - just a tiny patch of foam. Some particles can be seen floating in the brew. Aromas are very interesting: some deep roasted/caramel malts, resinous hops, ripe grapes, a tad of alcohol. Taste is rather sweet, but well "contained" by the brews hoppy character. Body is medium-full, texture pretty oily/slick, and carbonation almost flat. Finish is rather bitter, and medium in lenght. There is also, however, a presence of a post-taste which is also bitter and which lasts pretty long in fact. Overall: a fantastic brew as well as discovery for me. I had never drank a Doppelsticke before, and I guess that if I ever drink any others, this one will have set the bar. And that bar is pretty high!

After looking for this beer off and on for three years I finally have it. The year on the bottle is difficult to read but I believe this is a 2012 bottle. Bottle poured into a tulip. Pours a muddy brown with small white foam. Aroma is wood, booze, and caramel. Flavor is boozey on first sip to the back of the tongue followed by oak a presence of hops and roasted/sweet malts. Im a big fan, this is definitely a sipping beer.

UPDATED: AUG 16, 2014 Fantastica birra, una piacevole casuale scoperta in un pub.
